comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/yavne] Hi Tom! It's a prehistoric megalithic tomb built with large stones (megaliths) in the Neolithic period (late Stone Age), ca 4000-1800 BC.
 /Anna B.

comment.author: 24102779@N08
comment._content: Thank you Anna B. ))) Interesting place!

comment.author: 20963518@N00
comment._content: We have these all over the countryside. A few places you will find 'long-dolmen' also. They are covered with grass and often have trees growing on them. One of the best preserved ones and very impressing is Kongehøjen. www.fortidsmindeguide.dk/Kongehoejen.bs001.0.html

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/bogeskov] Thank you for telling us more about these ancient Danish monuments!
/Anna B.
